title: Natural Magic & Early Modern Science: Della Porta to Wilkins
description: The bridge between Renaissance magic and early modern science: Della Porta's encyclopedic Magia Naturalis and John Wilkins's mathematical explanations of mechanical wonders.
keyWorks: Della Porta Magia Naturalis: 20-book encyclopedia of 'natural magic' - experiments in optics, magnetism, alchemy, cryptography, distillation. Major influence on early modern science despite magical framing.
Wilkins Mathematical Magick: Explains mechanical wonders (automata, perpetual motion attempts) through mathematics and mechanics, demystifying 'magic'
researchValue: Della Porta's work bridges magic and science - his experiments were genuine natural philosophy despite esoteric packaging. Influenced Bacon, Boyle, and the Royal Society. Wilkins (founder of Royal Society) reinterprets magical wonders as mechanical phenomena.
